Job Description

We are seeking a .NET Developer Intern to assist in the development process for building .NET applications using ASP.NET, C#, and JavaScript. A Developer Intern would be responsible for parts of the development, integration, and implementation of features of the software, as well as the R&D research and documentation aspects that come with the project. As part of this internship, you’ll learn how to develop and test code efficiently while gaining real world experience working on applications that support our customers. With mentoring from Senior Developers, the intern will learn multiple systems and be able to use their skills in multiple projects and maintenance, and coordinate with the rest of the team working on different layers of the infrastructure.

What can you expect from us?

We offer a rewarding paid internship program that will provide valuable experiences to enhance your college career.

  • Competitive hourly wage and flexible hours (flex time)
  • Hands on learning experience from industry professionals
  • Ability to continue internship into the schoolyear, should your schedule allow, and should there be a continued need in the team
  • An opportunity to test and grow your skills in a corporate setting
  • Opportunity to gain full time employment post-graduation
  • Convenient location at 270 & 315 in Worthington.
  • Right next to the Olentangy Park trail and river (great for lunchtime walks or walk-and-talk meetings)
  • Gain knowledge and experience in the following topics/areas: Object-Oriented Programming Principles (OOP), Design Standards, .NET, ASP.NET, C#, Web Forms, SQL, JavaScript, Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), Agile/Waterfall Software Development, server design/architectural patterns (e.g. Model-View-Controller (MVC)), and general Server-Side Development (e.g. ASP.Net, SQL Server, Oracle, PHP)

Responsibilities

Depending on current project needs, responsibilities could entail any of the following:

  • Translate application storyboards and use cases into architecture concepts and pseudocode
  • Help design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable C# code by writing clean, scalable code using Object Oriented Programming Principles (OOP) and our defined Development Standards guide
  • Help ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications by identifying any observed bottlenecks and bugs, and suggesting solutions / technical alternatives to mitigate and address these issues; Make recommendations towards the development of new code or reuse of existing code, and improve/streamline processes and systems
  • Support projects through entire Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) by participating in the requirements analysis and research gathering (R&D) process, and/or writing documentation such as technical specifications, user guides, and other forms of documentation.
  • Interact with team members (end-users, testers, distributors, analysts and project/release managers) in a team-oriented fashion
  • Follow software development methodologies and best practices
  • Assist in system improvements and bug fixing; Track support ticket progress, and ensure tickets are successfully implemented through following up with developers and QA team.

Requirements

The Developer Intern must be currently enrolled at an accredited university pursuing a degree in a related field of study, and be able to demonstrate the following skills and experience (either through in an internship, previous employment, or in a college project):

  • Must be enrolled as a student at an accredited college or university, with at least sophomore status, OR 2+ years of the following: equivalent training or education (technical schools, coding bootcamps, etc.), and/or relevant full-time/contract work.
  • Additional 2+ years of cumulative programming/relevant experience, such as contracting, internships/previous employment, and/or online publishing via open-source collaboration.
  • Familiarity with the .NET framework, and proven experience developing C#/.NET scripts, programs, or applications
  • Knowledge of Visual Studio development environment, or similar integrated development environment (IDE)
  • Basic familiarity with GIT, Subversion, or similar version control systems.
  • Basic understanding of Design Patterns and Object-Oriented Concepts.
  • Experience or familiarity with the software development lifecycle (SDLC), including requirements analysis, development, production deployment and maintenance; Experience or understanding of working in an Agile environment.
  • Experience or familiarity with the ASP.NET framework, Server design/architectural patterns (e.g. Model-View-Controller (MVC)), and general Server-Side Development (e.g. ASP.Net, SQL Server, Oracle, PHP) is a definite PLUS.
  • Experience with HTML/CSS, JSON Requests, and Responsive Web Development is a definite PLUS.
  • Experience in other languages such as JavaScript or Mobile based (Objective-C, Java, Swift, etc.) is a definite PLUS.
  • Working knowledge of MS Office products
  • Ability to function well in a collaborative, team-oriented environment.
  • Ability to write technical documentation for internal or external developer/technical audiences.
  • Applicant must possess good written and spoken English language skills (fluent or conversant in English).
  • US Citizen, capable of gaining a security clearance preferred.

We’re doing work that matters. Help us solve what others can’t.

position: Deep Learning Software Intern, Autonomous Vehicles - Fall 2021
description:
We are looking for an extraordinary Deep Learning Software Intern to develop NVIDIA's deep learning solutions in autonomous driving vehicles. As a member of our Solution Engineering-Automotive Machine Learning team, you will utilize ground breaking NVIDIA deep learning model training/inference software libraries for deployment on NVIDIA's hardware architecture. You will develop new deep learning architectures, deploy deep learning models in low precision, and compile and optimize DNN graphs. As a part of this role, you will be building a close technical relationship with our internal automotive/framework teams during product development and coordinate with the architecture and software teams to develop the best solution on our platforms.

What you'll be doing:

  • Train, fine-tune, optimize and customize perception DNNs in low precision (FP16/INT8)

  • Apply low precision inference, quantization, and compression of DNNs

  • Design and develop robust inferencing software that can be scaled to multiple platforms for functionality and performance

  • Performance analysis, optimization and tuning

  • You'll collaborate across the company to guide the direction of machine learning inferencing, working with software, research and product teams

What we need to see:

  • Pursuing MS or PhD degree from a leading University in a relevant field, e.g. engineering, computer science, or computer engineering or equivalent

  • 3+ years of relevant software development experience

  • Excellent C/C++ programming and software design skills, including debugging, performance analysis, and test design.

  • You should display a real passion for artificial intelligence and computer vision, and knowledge of the latest developments in DL and AI.

  • Experience working with deep learning frameworks like Caffe, TensorFlow and PyTorch

  • Dedicated and able to work without supervision

Ways to stand out from the crowd:

  • Experience with low precision inference, quantization, compression of DNNs

  • Experience with NVIDIA software libraries such as CUDA and TensorRT

  • Open source project ownership or contribution, healthy GitHub repositories, guiding and/or mentoring experience.

NVIDIA is leading the way in groundbreaking developments in Artificial Intelligence, High-Performance Computing and Visualization. The GPU, our invention, serves as the visual cortex of modern computers and is at the heart of our products and services. Our work opens up new universes to explore, enables amazing creativity and discovery, and powers what were once science fiction inventions from artificial intelligence to autonomous cars. NVIDIA is looking for great people like you to help us accelerate the next wave of artificial intelligence.

The Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act requires that NVIDIA provide the compensation range and benefits offered for this position if performed in Colorado. The base hourly range for this position in Colorado is $31.80 - 43.73 USD.

NVIDIA also offers a comprehensive benefits package. We provide health care coverage, dental and vision, 401(K), including company matching and after tax contributions, Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP), Employee Assistance Program (EAP), company paid holidays, paid sick leave, vacation leave, professional time off, life and disability protection. Employees in eligible sales and positions may also be eligible for commission.

Linqia is the leader in the growing influencer marketing industry. At Linqia, we partner with the world's largest brands including Danonne, AB InBev, Kimberly-Clark, Unilever, and Walmart to build compelling and effective influencer marketing campaigns. Our AI-driven platform and team of experts are leading the transformation of influencer marketing.

We value intelligence, recognize talent and have instilled a culture that supports career development and growth for our employees. We thrive on innovation and accountability, with a customer first attitude that adds true value to everything we touch. Our team members are smart, hard-working, have integrity and love to have fun as we play to win. At Linqia, you'll be working with others who are passionate about marketing in a fun, fast-paced and data-driven environment.

The Role:
We are growing fast and looking for a talented machine-learning software engineering intern to join the engineering team this summer for a 3 month paid opportunity. The ideal candidate should be someone who is currently or just graduated with a relevant degree and has some knowledge of ML foundations. This is a great opportunity to work on an impactful project, while learning ML applications with Linqia's backend team. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment where you're surrounded by driven, passionate, and motivated people, then Linqia is the place for you!

Responsibilities:
Design and Develop Automation workflows for provisioning Software Infrastructure span

Design and Develop Microservices and Applications for Data Extraction, Information Retrieval and Data Analysis

Manage deployment and orchestration Infrastructure and related Automation (Apache Mesos, Kubernetes)

Manage and Deploy Distributed Queuing and Streaming platforms (Apache Kafka, Apache ActiveMQ)

Manage and Deploy Database Infrastructure (Relational and Non Relational)

Qualifications:
Currently pursuing or completed a B.S., M.S., or Ph.D in computer science, statistics, mathematics, electrical engineering, machine learning, or related technical field

Python, Java, Shell Scripting

Hands-on experience with machine learning, data mining, natural language processing or statistics

Experience with Data Analysis and Machine Learning Libraries like Pandas, Gensim, Pytorch, TensorFlow, etc.

Experience with Source Control Management esp. Git

Ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to other team members.

Familiarity with Agile software development processes

Very good understanding of Relational Databases and SQL

Very good understanding of Linux/Unix platforms and System Tools.

Nice to Have:
Masters or PHD in computer science or other technical related field.

Experience working and writing automation workflows for AWS, Google Cloud Platform or other cloud infrastructure

Experience deploying, configuring and managing Queuing Systems

Experience deploying, configuring and managing Non Relational Databases

Experience with Microservice based infrastructure.

Experience with Software Infrastructure Automation and tools such as Ansible, Puppet, Docker

Job Summary:

Apply Now

NVIDIA’s invention of the GPU 1999 sparked the growth of the PC gaming market, redefined modern computer graphics, and revolutionized parallel computing. More recently, GPU deep learning ignited modern Artificial Intelligence — the next era of computing — with the GPU acting as the brain of computers, robots, and self-driving cars that can perceive and understand the world. Today, we are increasingly known as “the AI computing company”. We are looking to grow our teams with the smartest people in the world. If you're creative and autonomous, we want to hear from you!

NVIDIA is looking for an intern security engineer to work on building innovative solutions to secure our GPU Cloud infrastructure. The exact tasks will depend on your profile

What You Will Be Doing:

  • Design and development of tools and systems that broadly align with prevention, detection and response security functions

  • Integrate tools with the build pipeline to detect security vulnerabilities early in the software development lifecycle

  • Develop, deploy and operate systems to solve challenges around application security, vulnerability patch automation, intrusion detection, continuous monitoring etc.

  • Work on sandboxing untrusted applications on our GPU enabled Kubernetes clusters

What We Need To See:

  • Enrolled in a Bachelors in CS or related field.

  • Excellent programming skills in one or more programming languages (C, C++, Java, Golang, Python)

  • Familiarity with cryptographic algorithms, authentication protocols, and transport layer security

  • Knowledge of the internals of UNIX-based operating systems with a focus on security

Ways To Stand Out From The Crowd:

  • Experience with the Go programming language

  • Strong interest in security domain

  • Experience with AWS, Docker containers, or Kubernetes

  • Knowledge of GPU programming such as OpenCL or CUDA is a plus.

Are you dedicated, upbeat and dynamic with excellent analytical ability? Are you a software engineer passionate and highly motivated about solving complex problems? If so, you may be a perfect fit for our group.

GC Image, LLC, seeks applicants for student internships in scientific
software development. We understand that academic studies requires
flexible scheduling, so the internships have flexible working hours of 10-20
hours per week and our offices are conveniently located in the heart of
the Haymarket District. We also have full-time positions after graduation.

GC Image is a global leader in software for multidimensional
chromatography and mass spectrometry. Our scientific software has
advanced tools for multidimensional/multispectral data visualization,
processing, analysis, and informatics. We have customers in countries
throughout Europe, North and South America, East and Southeast Asia
and Australia, South Asia, South Africa, and the Arabian Gulf.

GC Image conducts state-of-the-art research and development of data
analytics and cheminformatics. It has been funded by the National
Science Foundation and National Institutes of Health to develop
innovative informatics for pattern recognition with biological samples and
discovering biomarkers indicative of health and disease states. As an
intern at GC Image, you would have the opportunity to be involved in this
advanced research and development.

Applicants should be computer science or computer engineering majors
and/or have significant programming experience in a high-level
object-oriented programming language (preferably Java). A background
that includes GUI development, image processing, computer graphics,
and/or chemistry is a plus, but not required.

If you are interested in a internship with GC Image, send email with a
resume, official or unofficial transcripts, and contact information for three
references to jobs@gcimage.com. Interviews will begin as soon as we
receive applications.
Posted: November 6, 2017

PO Box 57403 Phone: +1.402.310.4503 Email: info@gcimage.com
Lincoln NE 68505-7403 Fax: +1.402.436.2660 http://www.gcimage.com/

If you are a current student looking for an opportunity with a company you can grow with…look no further! We are seeking part-time remote interns for the 2020-2021 school year to join our software development product team. We are interested in students who have at least completed their sophomore year of college within computer science, computer engineering, or a related discipline with professional/intern experience. Company Overview

Integrand Software, Inc. makes software for designing high frequency, RF and mixed signal complex integrated circuits (ICs) for the semiconductor industry. Our electromagnetic (EM) simulation tool, EMX®, allows designers to simulate large RF circuit blocks, characterize the behavior of passive components and analyze the parasitics due to interconnect. More than 50 companies rely on EMX to verify their ICs. The world’s major foundries use EMX to develop passive component models for their process design kits.

position: Research Intern - Machine Learning and Signal Processing in Speech and Computer Vision
description:
Research Internships at Microsoft provide a dynamic environment for research careers with a network of world-class research labs led by globally-recognized scientists and engineers. Our researchers and engineers pursue innovation in a range of scientific and technical disciplines to help solve complex challenges in diverse fields, including computing, healthcare, economics, and the environment.

We are looking for a Ph.D intern to help deliver market changing products. Our group is constantly faced with complex problems from machine learning and signal processing in the areas of audio, speech, and computer vision. Be part of a startup science group that embraces the latest engineering practices and is working on cutting-edge technologies. A perfect fit in this environment requires you to be:
  • Adaptable to meet dynamic goals in an agile team.
  • Self-motivated and proactive.
  • Passionate about creating new, innovative, and ground-breaking user experiences.
  • Motivated and able to quickly learn new technologies.


Responsibilities

Interns put inquiry and theory into practice. Alongside fellow doctoral candidates and some of the world’s best researchers, interns learn, collaborate, and network for life. Interns not only advance their own careers, but they also contribute to exciting research and development strides. During the 12-week internship, students are paired with mentors and expected to collaborate with other interns and researchers, present findings, and contribute to the vibrant life of the community. Research internships are available in all areas of research, and are offered year-round, though they typically begin in the summer.

Qualifications

In addition to the qualifications below, you’ll need to submit a minimum of two reference letters for this position. After you submit your application, a request for letters may be sent to your list of references on your behalf. Note that reference letters cannot be requested until after you have submitted your application, and furthermore, that they might not be automatically requested for all candidates. You may wish to alert your letter writers in advance, so they will be ready to submit your lettr.


Required Qualifications

  • Must be currently enrolled in a PhD program in Computer Science or a related STEM field.
  • Actively working on one or more areas from audio, speech, computer vision, and machine learning.
  • Published any academic paper as a first author in a major conference in one of those areas.


Preferred Qualifications

  • Experiences on deep learning framework: Tensorflow and PyTorch
  • Ability to deal with ambiguity and work well under pressure
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills

Company Overview

WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.

Business Unit Overview

NetherRealm: The creative team that brought Mortal Kombat and Injustice to life is now NetherRealm Studios, part of the Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment family. With over 20 years of creation under our belts, NetherRealm’s mission remains the same; to create cutting edge entertainment and deliver industry leading tech, game art and overall gaming experiences. NetherRealm Studios is a collaborative and creative environment, constantly striving to up the ante on what is possible in interactive entertainment. We encompass the best of both worlds – a team of dedicated professionals with years of experience, who are also at the forefront of an industry taking over the entertainment landscape. The passion and energy that made Mortal Kombat a reality is still on display every day in our offices, our hallways and most definitely the studio’s arcade room! Monolith: For the past 20 years Monolith has been obsessed with delivering a unique gaming experience for our fans. Starting with Blood, our very first title – all the way to our most recent offering, Middle-Earth: Shadow of Mordor, we are constantly pushing the envelope to combine innovative gameplay, inventive narratives, cutting edge tech & AI, and stunning visuals. We are challenging ourselves even further to ensure that our next game is going to be our best yet. That’s where you come in – for us to achieve that we need the best and brightest talent the industry has to offer. Come join us and help create our next AAA title! Turbine: Founded in 1994, Turbine, Inc., a Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment development studio, is focused on creating free-to-play games for mobile platforms. The studio is utilizing its extensive expertise in creating persistent online worlds that foster powerful social gaming communities to develop its mobile titles, which include Batman™: Arkham Underworld and the upcoming Game of Thrones® mobile game. Avalanche: Avalanche Software was acquired by Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment from Disney in 2016. The studio's first title under WBIE is a companion video game to the upcoming Cars 3, in partnership with Warner Bros., Disney, and Pixar. WB Games SF: Warner Bros. is a top video games publisher across multiple platforms. In mobile games, we have a growing portfolio of hits that includes DC Legends, Mortal Kombat X, and LEGO Star Wars: The Complete Saga, and we continue to expand by adding great people and leveraging the best portfolio of brands and intellectual property in the industry, such as DC Comics, Harry Potter, and LEGO. We are looking to add enthusiastic, talented and experienced professionals to our Mobile Publishing team. WB Games New York: WB Games New York works with some of the top talent in the game industry to build online competitive and social features for video games. Our highly experienced team of engineers utilize cutting-edge technology to build game services that are robust and scalable enough to support world-class developers such as NetherRealm Studios, Rocksteady, Monolith Productions, WB Montréal, and more!

Opportunity Overview

The Job

WB Games Inc. seeks a Data Engineer Intern for the WB Games Boston Data Analytics department.

The WB Games studio is looking for passionate and curious professionals to help level up their data and analytics team. Like us, you love games, and love to have fun. We look for those whose curiosity drives them to try new things, aren’t afraid to fail, and continuously learn.

The Data challenges at WB Games are extensive and you can expect to level up in all data domains. This includes software engineering, cloud-based systems, truly BIG data engineering and analytics.

The Daily
  • Be part of the game development process, helping teams design and implement analytic-based features.
  • Learn the internals of building a robust end-to-end data pipeline on all levels especially in databases, data modelling, data processing infrastructure and software development.
  • Contribute code to production data systems and gain strong software engineering practice.
  • Gain hands-on experience in distributed data processing technologies: Redshift, Airflow, Presto and Looker.
  • Learn techniques for high volume distributed data processing and storages.
  • Ensure the integrity, availability, and confidentiality of data, database systems and supporting services.

The Essentials
  • You have a drive to learn, ask questions and motivation to find the answers.
  • You are familiar with one or more of these technologies: Python, PostgreSQL, Go
  • You are comfortable with DevOps cloud tools (Amazon, EC2, or Google Cloud) and have some working knowledge of monitoring tools
  • You have side projects or viewable public code on Github, Bitbucket, etc.
  • You are currently pursuing a BS or MS in Computer Science, Engineering, or related technical discipline, with an expected graduation date of 2020 or 2021

Bonus Skills
  • You love games and have checked out our current title
  • You are well-versed in object-oriented programming (OOP)
  • You have some experience with Hadoop or other data engineering or database software
  • You have side projects or viewable public code on Github, Bitbucket, etc.

But Wait, There’s More!

The Perks

  • Exclusive WarnerMedia events and advance screenings
  • Paid time off every year to volunteer for eligible employees
  • Access to well-being tools, resources, and freebies
  • Access to in-house learning and development resources

Responsibilities

In addition, the candidate will assist engineers in preparing product specifications/drawings (conceptualizing and designing cost effective solutions), product performance testing, preparing technical reports, documentation, and project coordination in support of the design engineer/product leader. JOB SUMMARY:
The NC Programming Intern will assist in creating NC programs for cutting and punching materials in the fabrication department. The main objective of this role is to create NC programs in a timely manner to keep the fabrication department on schedule and keep CNC machines operating to cut and punch parts for various facilities. The NC Programming Intern will work closely with the production supervisors, team leaders, design engineers, quality control, and materials management to ensure that product, process and procedural changes are implemented smoothly.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

These duties are not meant to be all-inclusive and other duties may be assigned.

  • Clean up extraneous data from CAD drawings and save in format for input to nesting software to maintain a more efficient part library function.

  • Apply correct tooling for punched parts, placing tabs to hold part in sheet. Apply correct cutting paths to laser and waterjet parts placing tabs to hold part in sheet.

  • Perform nesting of parts, ensuring efficiency of part placement in material sheets; create NC programs for parts too large for nesting or requiring special tooling such as louvers.

  • Compare order revision to part library revision and update as needed to match manufacturing order; verify part is correctly routed to fabrication machines.

  • Ensure that NC programs are delivered to fabrication department before scheduled start date to ensure fabrication stays on schedule and deliver parts in time for next operation.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Student working towards an Associate’s degree for entire duration of internship.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

  • GPA of 3.0 or greater

Familiarity and interest in other robotic products is a plus.

Maximum 28 hours per week
Students in Computer Science and Engineering Technology are encouraged to apply.



Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Preferred Qualifications

Sitting, Bending.

Web Development Intern

DESCRIPTION:

We are looking to hire a Web Development Intern to work in our Technology Department. This position is flexible with hours and days, but the ideal applicant must commit to working at least 16 hours per week. Letters of recommendation are provided, and this position offers the opportunity to learn valuable skills.

At Northern Infinity Group, we provide direct marketing products and services to help small businesses acquire quality leads, improve conversion rates and increase sales volume. We always produce an exceptional standard of work for our clients by delivering real results and providing outstanding customer service.

We offer support and training, but in order to qualify for this position you must have strong customer service skills, organization skills, and a willingness to make some serious money. We also expect you to be results-oriented, flexible, and outgoing. The ideal candidate will be a great listener and a self-motivated team player with a positive mindset.

/p>

RESPONSIBILITIES:

    Develop Web base application and enhancing existing tools
    Develop tools for automation and testing for frontend and backend
    Help with testing and support web based applications
    Take projects from specification to end user experience
    Collaborate closely with assigned teams and departments
    Other duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS:

    Highly proficient with the LAMP stack
    Highly proficient in HTML, including CSS
    Significant experience working with AJAX, JSON and XML
    PHP/MySQL Experience
    Outstanding written and verbal communication skills
    Ability to manage multiple projects and consistently meet high standards
    Ability to learn technical systems and tasks quickly
    Strong analytical and problem-solving skills required
    Knowledge of Microsoft Word and Excel
    Ability to work independently, execute and move to the next task quickly

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:

    Previous internship experience preferred
    Currently enrolled as a student at an accredited university studying computer science, engineering, math or related science/business field

EMPLOYMENT TYPE:

    Internship

EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY:

    Northern Infinity Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All aspects of employment and consideration for employment with us are governed on the basis of merit, competence, and qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other category protected by federal, state, or local law.

HOW TO APPLY:

    Email your resume, cover letter and answers to the following questions.
    1. Why are you interested in this Internship?
    2. Why do you think you are qualified for this position?
    3. What do you expect this position to be like?
    4. Describe the ideal work environment to do your best work.
    5. What makes you unique from other candidates?
    6. How would you assess your writing and communication skills?
    7. How would you assess your computer and technical skills?
    8. What do you want to learn from this internship?
    9. If you had to rank in order the top five things you are looking for in a good job, what would they be?
    10. Have you had previous internship experience? Why or why not?
    11. What can you do for us that other candidates can not?
    12. What activities are you involved in outside of school/work?
    13. Have you ever quit a job or a project? Why?
    14. Did you work while in school?
    15. What type of job-related skills have you developed that may help you in this Internship?

EMAIL YOUR APPLICATION TO: careers@northerninfinitygroup.com

IPP is a global organization within NVIDIA. This group works with various other groups within NVIDIA Software such as Graphics Processors, Mobile Processors, Deep Learning, Artificial Intelligence and Driveless Cars to cater to their infrastructure needs. These cloud services provide almost half a million automated jobs per day on thousands of servers helping with the efficiency of thousands of NVIDIA's software engineers worldwide. The cloud hosts heterogeneous mix of machines and devices with various operating systems (Windows/Linux/Android), multitude of hardware platforms both NVIDIA GPUs and Tegra Processors. We’re looking for someone who can thrive in a fast moving environment and love being challenged to learn new things. You’ll come in with a basic understanding of engineering and operational principles and leave with a head filled to bursting with tools, processes, practices, and technology solutions.

What you'll be doing:

  • Developing and improving cloud automation, reporting, and monitoring

  • Proactively contribute to documentation, automation, and processes as they evolve

  • Learn about building and operating services at scale in a fast-iteration setup

  • Own small projects supporting internal process engineering efforts

  • Develop a working understanding of some of the common tools and practices used for microservice development and infrastructure

  • Work on fast paced DevOps engineering team

What we need to see:

  • Currently enrolled in a graduate program in Computer Science or related subject area. Completed undergraduate degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering is requirement

  • Strong object-oriented programming background, Java, Python preferred.

  • Familiarity with Container management solutions (Docker, Kubernetes)

  • Background with CI/CD tools (Jenkins etc.) & practice , source code management systems ex: Git , GitLab etc.

  • Familiarity with Relational Databases such as MySQL, NoSQL DBs such as Elastic Search, MongoDB, HBase

  • Ability to turn design, compliance, and support references/content into documentation, presentations, and training

Ways to stand out from the crowd:

  • Background with Windows, Linux operating systems as well as network technologies

  • Some familiarity with AWS or other cloud computing platforms

  • Ability to analyze situations and utilize troubleshooting skills, systems and tools, and problem solving abilities

NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people in the world working for us. If you're creative and passionate about developing cloud services we want to hear from you!

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

We are seeking a Web Developer Intern with the desire and skills needed to build sophisticated interfaces and solid, efficient backend infrastructures that enhance the end-user experience. We are looking for someone who is passionate about designing and developing scalable web-based applications, and is eager to make an impact at work and on the world.

Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, test, and maintain our scalable REST API
  • Build sophisticated user interfaces and back-end infrastructures
  • Manage individual project priorities and deadlines

Requirements

  • Self-starter, team player, quick learner with a positive and courageous attitude
  • Passion for designing clean, highly-scalable, efficient code
  • Major: Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Computer Engineering
  • Experience developing software or web-based applications
  • Experience with Java, C, C++, SQL, C#, .NET, WebAPI (or MVC), HTML, CSS/LESS/SASS, Javascript (the more the better)
  • SQL and SQL Management Studio experience
  • Clear communication of ideas through whiteboarding, wireframes, mockups or similar
  • Full Time, 40 hrs/week

Nice-to-Haves

  • Experience with AngularJS and Asynchronous Web Development
  • Experience with underscore.js and moment.js
  • Front-end GUI skills/experience (working examples are best)
  • Experience with Responsive User Interfaces
  • Experience with secure programming methods
  • Experience with Agile Development
  • Team-player with good communication skills

Compensation & Perks

  • Salary: $16.00/hr
  • Flexible Schedule
  • Experienced technical leadership to mentor your development skills as you develop cutting-edge, world-changing applications

Careers not Jobs

We believe in providing our team members with positions where they can make an immediate impact on the growth of our company and their careers. As a growing company, professional advancement opportunities are abundant, and employees are empowered to take on additional projects and responsibilities to continue to advance. We invest heavily in training our team and encourage continuous education inside and outside our company.

Apply

To learn more about how you can join one of the fastest growing supply chain tech companies, please email your cover letter and resume to talent@industrystar.com.

position: EDG Intern - Bachelor Computer Science Majors
description:
Looking for Fall 2021 Interns!

Interns in our Engineering Development Group gain hands-on experience in a welcoming environment that fosters and rewards innovation, teamwork, learning, and fun. You will make an impact by contributing to a real-world project and working with bright, passionate colleagues to push the limits of engineering and science. Increase your knowledge of software engineering, testing, and debugging while also developing valuable professional skills, such as written and oral communications, problem solving, and time management.


After training on MathWorks processes and tools, you will collaborate with a development team to implement updates for a future release of one of our 100+ products, or help develop automated tests to verify that features in MATLAB or Simulink are functioning as designed.

This internship will prepare you for a career at MathWorks starting in our Engineering Development Group (EDG).


Qualifications Required

Working towards a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science

Qualifications Preferred

  • 3 month full-time commitment
  • Object Oriented Programming experience (One or more of C++, Java OR JavaScript)

  • Strong academic record
  • MATLAB knowledge or experience is a plus

  • Candidates for this position must be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis for any employer without restriction.
  • Visa sponsorship will not be provided for this position.
  • Candidates must be pursuing a bachelor's level degree in a technical discipline.

Bluefin Technology Partners is a leading Digital Product and Service Consultancy that specializes in software development, connected products (IoT), and Voice Application development. We think, design and build like start-up entrepreneurs, but have years of experience to back up our development.

We are currently looking to expand our team of experts with an exceptional individual with a passion for developing the Voice Applications. This person will join our team of talented engineers who are passionate about using extraordinary efforts to deliver quality products to our growing list of clients.

As a voice application developer intern, you will be responsible for helping complete tasks assigned by the technical project lead and project manager. You will become responsible for assisting in the development lifecycle of several voice applications currently in development and support those in production. You will be an essential part of our development team here at Bluefin. Dive deep into the ocean of ingenuity with Bluefin Technology Partners!

Qualifications

  • Extensive knowledge of JSON

  • Familiar with AWS services such as Lambda, and SES and how to read and implement documentation relating to the service

  • Strength in reading documentation that is language agnostic (ex. A JSON response that needs to be applied with a language such as node.js)

  • Familiar with Voice Design best practices and VUI design

  • Have a strong understanding of OOP and be proficient in at least one language

  • Knowledge of how to make external API calls asynchronously

  • Familiar with some type of version control (git, bitbucket, github)

  • Showcase at least one work of software that showcases your abilities to develop code

  • Very basic understanding of good code architecture practices

  • Familiar with Alexa Skills kit console and Alexa based jargon(ex: Interaction model, Intents, Utterances)

  • Somebody who loves to work with other people as a team

  • Ability to be technologically adaptive and meet deadlines

Bonus Points for

  • Experience with node.js specific development

  • Cloudwatch experience

  • Developed and deployed an Alexa Skill

  • Implemented efficient algorithms to develop scalable code

  • Alexa Skills Kit CLI knowledge

  • Understands Software modularization and security practices(ex: Not exposing APIs, API secrets kept as environment variables)

  • Google Home experience

Additional Information

  • Work with a team of experts, located in multiple countries

  • Work in collaboration with other corporate partners

  • Flexible hours

  • Paid position

  • Partial remote work opportunities

  • Located in the Worcester Innovation Center (Worcester Idea Lab)

Sound like you? Email us at Contact@bluefintechpartners.com or fill out the form.

Do you want to join an established, 10+ year-old team that operates like a startup? At Velocity Squared, we use the latest technologies to solve unique challenges for our customers, and we have fun doing it.

Velocity Squared is looking for smart, excited, and creative interns to help get new projects off the ground. We are a small team with very few boundaries on our roles and almost zero “policies” but we work with large clients who have some very large, complex, and challenging projects. At Velocity Squared, we use innovative processes and the latest technologies to build web based solutions that solve challenges for our customers, while always making our developers’ needs a priority.

We want to hire smart, problem solvers, and we work hard to develop mutual trust and respect with each and every employee.

What to Expect

  • Work closely with the team on anything from new feature development to investigating and fixing bugs to developing automated test suites
  • Use the right tools for the job-we’re developers too and enjoy taking advantage of the latest tools and frameworks
  • A casual, comfortable work environment (shorts are the norm)
  • Most weeks we go to lunch together at least once and the company picks up the tab
  • Like everyone else, we have a fridge stocked with free drinks (but ours also has beer)

Requirements

  • Working towards an Engineering, CS, or related degree
  • Genuine curiosity and enthusiasm for software development both personally and professionally
  • Have the ability to solve problems independently
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Permanent legal right to work in the United States

Personality Traits

  • Eager to learn and always curious about how things work
  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills
  • The ability to respectfully disagree with colleagues and discuss issues on their merits

Nice to Have (but not necessary)

  • Experience with Microsoft C# / .NET / SQL Server
  • Experience building Web Solutions with technologies like ASP.NET, Ruby on Rails, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, or equivalent
  • Experience with Entity Framework or Web Services
  • Experience with Git / GitHub and/or Mercurial
  • Javascript Framework programming experience with VueJS, React, Angular, or similar
  • Experience with other programming languages (PHP, Ruby, etc.)
  • Experience with Cloud solutions like AWS or Azure

This is a paid, part-time position $15 - $20/hr depending on experience. We understand college schedules and are can be flexible with work schedule to accommodate class times and tests.

As a Fortune 500 company, Packaging Corporation of America (PCA) is an ideas and solutions company. Our corrugated packaging business seeks to be the leader in helping our customers — large and small — package, transport and display products of all kinds. Our white paper business delivers Paper With Purpose by providing the highest level of customer service and operational excellence. We have approximately 15,000 team members in more than 100 locations in the United States that strive to meet the local needs of our customers. Our mission is to serve the needs of our customers, today and tomorrow, with products and services that exceed expectations for performance and environmental responsibility.

Solution Engineer Intern


Stonebranch builds dynamic IT automation solutions that transform business IT environments from simple IT task automation into sophisticated, real-time business service automation, helping organizations achieve the highest possible Return on Automation. No matter the degree of automation, Stonebranch software is simple, modern and secure. Using its universal automation platform, enterprises can seamlessly orchestrate workloads and data across technology ecosystems and silos. Headquartered in Alpharetta, Georgia with points of contact and support throughout the Americas, Europe, and Asia, Stonebranch serves some of the world's largest financial, manufacturing, healthcare, travel, transportation, energy, and technology institutions.


Your Part in this Growth Story:


Stonebranch is searching for a Solution Engineer Intern who’s interested in playing in the explosive IT automation market. As a Solution Engineer intern, you will contribute your knowledge and ideas in helping our Professional Services team on implementation projects of Stonebranch’s Universal Automation Center (UAC) family of products.


You will work under the guidance of a more senior engineer or team lead. Preference given to juniors, seniors, and recent graduates. This is a temporary role with potential to grow into a permanent position.


Your Impact on The Organization:


  • Participate in requirements sessions with the client to determine specific needs for product configuration.
  • Understand and participate in all the phases of Stonebranch’s UAC implementation including architectural analysis and design, deployment, conversion (from another existing software), development, optimization, and training.
  • Understand Stonebranch’s conversion methodology and support the client and other team members using it during a project implementation.
  • Understand the technical aspects of the conversion methodology and be ready to address issues and difficulties that may come up during the implementation process.
  • Take ownership tasks assigned to you and carry them out to completion in a timely manner.
  • Embrace Project Management and technical software implementation and configuration best practices.

What You Will Bring to the Team:


  • Full-time student pursuing undergraduate degree in one of the following fields or related studies: Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or Business Management.
  • Creative problem solving and critical thinking skills.
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills.
  • The desire and attitude to learn from Senior Engineers and work well in a collaborative environment.

NVIDIA’s invention of the GPU in 1999 sparked the growth of the PC gaming market, redefined modern computer graphics, and revolutionized parallel computing. More recently, GPU deep learning ignited modern AI — the next era of computing — with the GPU acting as the brain of computers, robots, and self-driving cars that can perceive and understand the world. Today, we are increasingly known as “the AI computing company.” We're looking to grow our company, and build our teams with the smartest people in the world. Would you like to join us at the forefront of technological advancement?

Join our Jarvis conversational AI team and help build the real-time, cost-effective computing platform driving our success in this exciting and quickly growing field. Intelligent machines powered by AI computers that can learn, reason and interact with people are no longer science fiction. Today, a virtual assistant powered by AI can engage with human to answer questions and perform tasks. An AI-powered chatbot can learn conversation skills through trial and error. This is truly an extraordinary time. The era of AI has begun.

What you'll be doing:

As a Software Intern on our Jarvis team, you will be working on research, design and implementation of SW features in the Jarvis conversational AI and intelligent assistant. You will use machine learning, deep learning speech, NLP, and computer vision techniques combined with rules-based domain specification to build high performant conversational AI services with robust API interface for data center, cloud, and embedded platforms.

What we need to see:

  • Pursuing BS/MS degree in Computer Science/EE or related

  • Strong fundamentals in embedded systems, programming and SW design

  • You have strong knowledge of ML/DL techniques, algorithms and tools with exposure to CNN, RNN (LSTM), transformers (BERT & GPT-2/3), NLP, speech, and/or Computer Vision

  • Shown ability to develop robust and efficient APIs (REST, RPC, GRPC) for machine learning model inference and managing related workflows.

  • Excellent fluency with C/C++ and Python

  • Strongly believe that prototyping is the right way to prove the idea

Ways to stand out from the crowd:

  • NLP, speech or audio processing experience is highly desired

  • Experience with building machine learning model inference pipeline as a service

  • Experience with deploying machine learning models on data center, cloud, and embedded systems

  • Background with one of the following: dialog systems and conversational platforms, computer vision, signal processing

  • Familiarity with GPU computing (CUDA, OpenCL, OpenACC)

  • Background with Dockers and Kubernetes

  • Familiarity with ONNX and TensorRT

  • Worked with variety of vision, depth and audio sensors

position: Interactive Voice Response (IVR) Technical Maintenance Intern
description:
Resp & Qualifications

This is a Year-Round Internship. We are looking for students who can commit to work up to 15-20 hours per week during the academic year in the Fall/Spring and 40 hours per week during the summer.

PURPOSE:

The IVR Technical Maintenance Intern role exists as a hire strategy to bring in incumbents enrolled in an accredited college or university who are pursuing a bachelor’s degree in a data science or related field to learn the business and technical side of IVR Technology Maintenance from the ground up. InterActive Voice Response Technology enables a CareFirst Member or a Provider of Medical, Dental or Vision services to receive answers to routine questions through the use of telephonic self service and enables intelligent phone call routing and call handing. This role will require interaction with IVR Support Technicians, Business Analysts and business partners within the organization. This position will use SQL and Java to perform maintenance, fulfill reporting requirements and research reports of trouble. This is a fast-paced, collaborative and iterative environment requiring quick learning, flexibility and problem solving.

PRINCIPLE ACCOUNTABILITIES:

Under the leadership and direction of a Manager of IVR Support, the principal duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to the following in a continuous learning environment. Resource will assist in the following:

  • Run SQL Queries (process documented/will train specifics) and copy the results to a excel sheet.
  • Run batch files (process documented/will train specifics)
  • Run reports from a web based portal (process documented/will train specifics) and distribute them
  • Run searches on logs to help with diagnostic research
  • Help technical staff with maintenance of tables and property files

QUALIFICATIONS:

Required

Undergraduate student enrolled in an accredited college or university at either the Junior/Senior level with a GPA of 3.25 or above. Student should be pursuing a degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics or closely related field. Graduate level students will also be considered.

Abilities/Skills

Students should possess the following skills:

  • Familiarity with windows servers
  • Familiarity with remote desktop
  • Familiarity with Microsoft Office and Teams
  • Familiarity or willingness to learn Splunk
  • Familiarity with SQL – we have pre-written queries that we will share for most things, but some may have to be written – like for table updates
  • Familiarity with Java
  • Strong research, analytical, written and oral communication skills
  • Ability to demonstrate problem solving skills and willingness to learn
  • Willingness to work with and learn new technologies

at Rivian Automotive

position: 3D NAND Mixed Signal Pre Silicon Verification Graduate Intern (-SK)
description:
Job Description


This position is associated with the sale of Intel's NAND memory and storage business to SK Hynix (You can read more about the transaction in the press release - https://newsroom.intel.com/wpcontent/uploads/sites/11/2020/10/nand-memory-news-q-a.pdf ).

This is an exciting time To be at Intel come join our team as an Intern and work on one of the most advanced 3DNAND and SSD technology portfolios in the world. As the global leader in the semiconductor industry Intel possesses many industry leading SSD technologies including the most capable Quadruple Level Cell QLC NAND Flash products You will be part of a world class team that will transition to lead the SSD business at SK hynix.

This position aligns to Phase 2 of the transaction which includes NAND technology and component development along with fab operations Employees aligned to Phase 2 will continue to be employed by Intel and will continue to develop NAND technology and components and manufacture NAND wafers at the fab. Phase 2 of the transaction is expected to close in March 2025 at which time employees aligned to this phase of the transaction will transition employment to SK hynix.

Responsibilities may be quite diverse of a technical nature US experience and education requirements will vary significantly depending on the unique needs of the job Job assignments are usually for the summer or for short periods during breaks from school. This is a 5 months internship with the possibility to be extended.


Qualifications


You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your school work/classes/research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences.

Minimum Requirements:

  • The candidate must be pursuing a MS or PhD degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or related field.


Minimum 5+ months of experience or equivalent coursework in the following areas:

  • Verilog design and verification

  • Logic design and Mixed signal simulation verification

  • CMOS circuit design and verification

  • Semiconductor Device Physics

  • Scripting skills in Perl/Python


Preferred Requirements:
Minimum 5+ months of experience or equivalent coursework in the following areas:

  • NAND Flash or NOR Flash or Non-Volatile Memory

  • UVM verification methodology

  • AMS verification methodology and techniques

  • Understanding of programming language such as C, C++, Java

  • Unix environment

Non-Volatile Solutions Memory Group: The Non-Volatile Memory Solutions Group is a worldwide organization that delivers NAND flash memory products for use in Solid State Drives (SSDs), portable memory storage devices, digital camera memory cards, and other devices. The group is responsible for NVM technology design and development, complete Solid State Drive (SSD) system hardware and firmware development, as well as wafer and SSD manufacturing.

US, Oregon, Hillsboro;Virtual US and Canada

position: Jr. React Native Application Development Intern
description:
Do you have a passion for using technology to bring about social change? Are you interested in working in engineering at a nonprofit? If so, join the Benetech team as a summer intern!

Benetech is a nonprofit that empowers communities with software for social good. Our work transforms how people with disabilities read, learn, and gain meaningful employment and makes it safer for human rights defenders to pursue truth and justice.

As Jr. React Native Application Development Intern, you will design, implement, and deliver high-quality software projects in React Native. You will also get to participate in detailed design, coding, code walk throughs, peer code reviews and unit testing, project demonstrations and maintenance of software codebases.

We firmly believe in Doing More Together – it’s even one of our Truths! You can read more about our underlying values here: Benetech Truths.

Title:

Decision Support Software Engineering Intern

A year-round software engineering intern position is available at NASA Ames Research Center to contribute to the development of System Health Enabled Realtime Planning Advisor (SHERPA).

SHERPA is decision support system based on the principles of decision making under uncertainty. It is being used in traverse planning for the Volatiles Investigating Polar Exploration Rover (VIPER), planned for launch in late 2023.

Candidates must be available to contribute at least 15-20 hours per week. Candidates local to the San Francisco Bay Area are preferred, however remote participation will be considered in certain circumstances.

Undergraduate or early MS

***Must be U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident***

Responsibilities:

  • Assist with SHERPA software development

  • Optimize software performance

  • Maintain code base and documentation

  • Ensure compliance with flight software standards

  • [Optional] Lead or contribute to the development of SHERPA’s web-based graphical user interface

  • [Optional] Perform project management duties: track schedule, deliverables, and requirements; coordinate execution of tasks

Required Education, Experience, & Skills:

  • Working towards Bachelor’s Degree in computer science or engineering field

  • Excellent general programming skills and fluency in at least one high-level programming language (e.g., Julia, Python, Java)

  • Extensive experience using debuggers, profilers, documentation generators, version control systems, and other common software engineering tools

  • Strong organizational and communication skills

  • Aptitude for consistently documenting code and work

Desired Education, Experience & Skills:

  • Working towards Master ‘s Degree in computer science or engineering field

  • Fluency in Julia programming language (development will be done mostly in Julia)

  • Understanding of fundamentals of decision making under uncertainty (e.g., at the level of Stanford AA228/CS238 course)

  • Developing web-based graphical user interfaces (HTML, JavaScript)

  • Leaflet JavaScript library or similar map-handling software

  • Experience with with developing code from software requirements documents
