Company Overview

WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.

Business Unit Overview

NetherRealm: The creative team that brought Mortal Kombat and Injustice to life is now NetherRealm Studios, part of the Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment family. With over 20 years of creation under our belts, NetherRealm’s mission remains the same; to create cutting edge entertainment and deliver industry leading tech, game art and overall gaming experiences. NetherRealm Studios is a collaborative and creative environment, constantly striving to up the ante on what is possible in interactive entertainment. We encompass the best of both worlds – a team of dedicated professionals with years of experience, who are also at the forefront of an industry taking over the entertainment landscape. The passion and energy that made Mortal Kombat a reality is still on display every day in our offices, our hallways and most definitely the studio’s arcade room! Monolith: For the past 20 years Monolith has been obsessed with delivering a unique gaming experience for our fans. Starting with Blood, our very first title – all the way to our most recent offering, Middle-Earth: Shadow of Mordor, we are constantly pushing the envelope to combine innovative gameplay, inventive narratives, cutting edge tech & AI, and stunning visuals. We are challenging ourselves even further to ensure that our next game is going to be our best yet. That’s where you come in – for us to achieve that we need the best and brightest talent the industry has to offer. Come join us and help create our next AAA title! Turbine: Founded in 1994, Turbine, Inc., a Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment development studio, is focused on creating free-to-play games for mobile platforms. The studio is utilizing its extensive expertise in creating persistent online worlds that foster powerful social gaming communities to develop its mobile titles, which include Batman™: Arkham Underworld and the upcoming Game of Thrones® mobile game. Avalanche: Avalanche Software was acquired by Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment from Disney in 2016. The studio's first title under WBIE is a companion video game to the upcoming Cars 3, in partnership with Warner Bros., Disney, and Pixar. WB Games SF: Warner Bros. is a top video games publisher across multiple platforms. In mobile games, we have a growing portfolio of hits that includes DC Legends, Mortal Kombat X, and LEGO Star Wars: The Complete Saga, and we continue to expand by adding great people and leveraging the best portfolio of brands and intellectual property in the industry, such as DC Comics, Harry Potter, and LEGO. We are looking to add enthusiastic, talented and experienced professionals to our Mobile Publishing team. WB Games New York: WB Games New York works with some of the top talent in the game industry to build online competitive and social features for video games. Our highly experienced team of engineers utilize cutting-edge technology to build game services that are robust and scalable enough to support world-class developers such as NetherRealm Studios, Rocksteady, Monolith Productions, WB Montréal, and more!

Opportunity Overview

The Job

WB Games Inc. seeks a Data Engineer Intern for the WB Games Boston Data Analytics department.

The WB Games studio is looking for passionate and curious professionals to help level up their data and analytics team. Like us, you love games, and love to have fun. We look for those whose curiosity drives them to try new things, aren’t afraid to fail, and continuously learn.

The Data challenges at WB Games are extensive and you can expect to level up in all data domains. This includes software engineering, cloud-based systems, truly BIG data engineering and analytics.

The Daily
  • Be part of the game development process, helping teams design and implement analytic-based features.
  • Learn the internals of building a robust end-to-end data pipeline on all levels especially in databases, data modelling, data processing infrastructure and software development.
  • Contribute code to production data systems and gain strong software engineering practice.
  • Gain hands-on experience in distributed data processing technologies: Redshift, Airflow, Presto and Looker.
  • Learn techniques for high volume distributed data processing and storages.
  • Ensure the integrity, availability, and confidentiality of data, database systems and supporting services.

The Essentials
  • You have a drive to learn, ask questions and motivation to find the answers.
  • You are familiar with one or more of these technologies: Python, PostgreSQL, Go
  • You are comfortable with DevOps cloud tools (Amazon, EC2, or Google Cloud) and have some working knowledge of monitoring tools
  • You have side projects or viewable public code on Github, Bitbucket, etc.
  • You are currently pursuing a BS or MS in Computer Science, Engineering, or related technical discipline, with an expected graduation date of 2020 or 2021

Bonus Skills
  • You love games and have checked out our current title
  • You are well-versed in object-oriented programming (OOP)
  • You have some experience with Hadoop or other data engineering or database software
  • You have side projects or viewable public code on Github, Bitbucket, etc.

But Wait, There’s More!

The Perks

  • Exclusive WarnerMedia events and advance screenings
  • Paid time off every year to volunteer for eligible employees
  • Access to well-being tools, resources, and freebies
  • Access to in-house learning and development resources

description:
Organization
U.S. Department of Defense (DOD)
Reference Code
USAG-2021-0001
How to Apply

Components of the online application are as follows:

  • Profile Information
  • Educational and Employment History
  • Essay Questions (goals, experiences, and skills relevant to the opportunity)
  • Resume (PDF)
  • Transcripts/Academic Records -
  • Recommendation

Submitted documents must have all social security numbers, student identification numbers, and/or dates of birth removed (blanked out, blackened out, made illegible, etc.) prior to uploading into the application system.

If you have questions, send an email to Army@orise.orau.gov. Please list the reference code of this opportunity in the subject line of the email.

All documents must be in English or include an official English translation.

Description

The US Army Garrison- Fort Bliss is located in El Paso, Texas, specializing in strategic deployment platforms that execute deployment operations, enabling rapid and efficient unit deployment and re-deployment. Fort Bliss also provides facilities and services through a professional workforce that assists units in sustaining their readiness and promotes a safe and secure installation, empowering Soldiers, Families, and Civilians to thrive. The Directorate of Human Resources-Workforce, Administrative Services and Security Division (DHR-WASSD) supports Fort Bliss with management and oversight of the following departments: civilian workforce services, information technology support, workforce development, and knowledge management which plays a role within all installation services and communication.

Under the mentorship of the DHR-WASSD Chief and the Knowledge Management (KM) Specialist, DHR-WASSD will be offering an ORISE learning opportunity. This opportunity will focus on researching current best practices within the technology environment and applying the identified best practices to various Garrison-owned knowledge-sharing platforms. The ORISE participant will routinely support and perform tasks using various types of KM web applications and software. The participant will learn to execute plans to support and promote KM and maintain the continuous development of new organizational and online communities of practice, which will include: the development of training curriculum, the development of Standard Operating Procedure (SOP), and collaboration with the Network Enterprise Center (NEC) on required technological software to facilitate KM digital applications.

Additional learning objectives will include:

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Visio, Microsoft Power App Studio, InfoPath, and Active Navigation to support virtual records management
  • Establishing virtual workspaces for the transfer and sharing of lessons learned, best practices, and operational experiences
  • Ability to apply knowledge management and information management best practices to enhance information flow through digital platforms and processes
  • Applying the methods of digitally harnessing and archiving information related to records/information management
  • Full understanding of digital platforms and technology-based programs, gaining the experience to map processes and incorporate them into knowledge management systems to ensure consistency of business practices (both old and emerging) across the command

Appointment Length

This appointment is a twelve month research appointment, with the possibility to be renewed for additional research periods. Appointments may be extended depending on funding availability, project assignment, program rules, and availability of the participant.

Participant Benefits

Participants will receive a stipend to be determined by USAG. Other benefits may include the following:

  • Health Insurance Supplement. Participants are eligible to purchase health insurance through ORISE
  • Relocation Allowance
  • Training and Travel Allowance

Nature of Appointment

The participant will not enter into an employee/employer relationship with ORISE, ORAU, DOD, or any other office or agency. Instead, the participant will be affiliated with ORISE for the administration of the appointment through the ORISE appointment letter and Terms of Appointment.

While participants will not enter into an employment relationship with DOD or any other agency, this opportunity will require a suitability investigation/background investigation. Any offer made is considered tentative pending favorable outcome of the investigation.

Qualifications

Degree: Bachelor's Degree received within the last 60 months or currently pursuing

  • Familiarity with KM tools, content, processes and initiatives
  • Skilled in utilizing databases, portal sites, and SharePoint sufficient to develop queries, create and update databases and portal sites, create SharePoint sites, maintain document libraries, lists, and WSS site collections, and assign permissions.
  • Experience in developing metric deliverables and reporting of metadata for leadership.
  • Ability to collaboratively and effectively engage with higher headquarters and other agencies in the community.
  • Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously, establish priorities and work in an organized manner
  • Experience with community coalitions and strategic multi-disciplinary committees.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Eligibility Requirements
  • Citizenship: U.S. Citizen Only
  • Degree: Bachelor's Degree received within the last 60 months or currently pursuing.
  • Overall GPA: 2.00
  • Discipline(s):
    • Business
    • Communications and Graphics Design
    • Computer, Information, and Data Sciences
    • Earth and Geosciences
    • Engineering
    • Environmental and Marine Sciences
    • Life Health and Medical Sciences
    • Mathematics and Statistics
    • Nanotechnology
    • Other Physical Sciences
    • Physics
    • Social and Behavioral Sciences
  • Veteran Status: Veterans Preference, degree received within the last 120 month(s).

Applied Software Inc., which is also known as MagView, is a growing proprietary health software company that has a stable track record of growth in its niche market. We deliver quality software solutions to hospitals and breast centers across the nation that help save lives. The ideal candidate will be self-motivated, an independent worker, and polished along with having good communication skills. A positive attitude with the ability to prioritize tasks in a fast-paced and fluid work environment is imperative for this role. Strong attention to detail, flexibility, and interpersonal astuteness are key factors for the position.

THE ROLE

This intern will be immersed in the environment of a professional health software firm and see what it is like to work in an office environment. You will help by providing programming support to the development group. Applicants should have excellent analytical and math skills with the ability to work in teams. We are looking for students majoring in Computer Science/Network Engineering, Engineering, or Mathematics ideally.

RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Develop software as assigned (coding/programming).
  • Document/create/maintain automation tests, performance tests, procedures, records, and data.
  • Strong communication, documentation, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
  • Help analyze and diagnose performance, functional software, and customer issues.
  • Work closely with development engineers during product development life cycles and be involved in early field trials of release candidates.
  • Work with development team members to understand and communicate defects.
  • Flexibility to move across projects as needed.
  • Documentating and testing new software functionality.
Experience & Skills Requirements
  • Ability to write well-documented code (C#, Java, or other OO Language) and provide detailed user and developer documentation.
  • Ability to write comprehensive defect reports.
  • Ability to create and maintain testing data.
  • Ability to create and adhere to test design standards.
  • Excellent customer service orientation and teamwork skills.
  • Must have a working knowledge of client/server environments and personal computer hardware and software.
  • Experience with MS SQL preferred.
  • Experience in problem resolution support, system analysis, healthcare IT, or HL7 preferred.
  • Excellent customer service orientation and teamwork skills.
  • Positive, serving attitude with enthusiasm and passion that infects every call, meeting, and room you join.
MAJORS
  • Computer Science/Network Engineering, Engineering, or Mathematics.
Salary Range:

This is a flexible schedule, paid internship opportunity with pay that is commensurate with experience. We are looking for someone who is looking to grow in to full time development opportunity. Please include salary requirement with your resume.

WORK ENVIRONMENT:

Imagine a work world where people love the mission at work and like their team. The environment is pretty fast-paced with lots of continued learning required for all positions. We are a fun, diverse group, who happens to work at a fun software company that has a serious mission. We affect patient care in a positive way every day, which leaves you feeling like you accomplished something positive. We like laughter as it creates a bond that brings others together. Creativity, intuition, and flexibility are key to the successful operation of organizations today, and we try and foster that here.

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/magviewinc/?fref=ts

Twitter: https://twitter.com/magviewinc

NetherRealm: The creative team that brought Mortal Kombat and Injustice to life is now NetherRealm Studios, part of the Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment family. With over 20 years of creation under our belts, NetherRealm’s mission remains the same; to create cutting edge entertainment and deliver industry leading tech, game art and overall gaming experiences. The passion and energy that made Mortal Kombat a reality is still on display every day in our offices, our hallways and most definitely the studio’s arcade room! Monolith: For the past 20 years Monolith has been obsessed with delivering a unique gaming experience for our fans. Starting with Blood, our very first title – all the way to our most recent offering, Middle-Earth: Shadow of Mordor, we are constantly pushing the envelope to combine innovative gameplay, inventive narratives, cutting edge tech & AI, and stunning visuals. We are challenging ourselves even further to ensure that our next game is going to be our best yet. That’s where you come in – for us to achieve that we need the best and brightest talent the industry has to offer. Come join us and help create our next AAA title! Turbine: Founded in 1994, Turbine, Inc., a Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment development studio, is focused on creating free-to-play games for mobile platforms. The studio is utilizing its extensive expertise in creating persistent online worlds that foster powerful social gaming communities to develop its mobile titles, which include Batman™: Arkham Underworld and the upcoming Game of Thrones® mobile game. Avalanche: Avalanche Software was acquired by Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment from Disney in 2016. The studio's first title under WBIE is a companion video game to the upcoming Cars 3, in partnership with Warner Bros., Disney, and Pixar. WB Games SF: Warner Bros. is a top video games publisher across multiple platforms. We are looking to add enthusiastic, talented and experienced professionals to our Mobile Publishing team. WB Games New York: WB Games New York works with some of the top talent in the game industry to build online competitive and social features for video games. Our highly experienced team of engineers utilize cutting-edge technology to build game services that are robust and scalable enough to support world-class developers such as NetherRealm Studios, Rocksteady, Monolith Productions, WB Montréal, and more!

The Job



WB Games Inc. seeks a Data Engineer Intern for the WB Games Boston Data Analytics department.

The WB Games studio is looking for passionate and curious professionals to help level up their data and analytics team. Like us, you love games, and love to have fun. We look for those whose curiosity drives them to try new things, aren’t afraid to fail, and continuously learn.

The Data challenges at WB Games are extensive and you can expect to level up in all data domains. This includes software engineering, cloud-based systems, truly BIG data engineering and analytics.

The Daily


  • Be part of the game development process, helping teams design and implement analytic-based features.
  • Learn the internals of building a robust end-to-end data pipeline on all levels especially in databases, data modelling, data processing infrastructure and software development.
  • Contribute code to production data systems and gain strong software engineering practice.
  • Gain hands-on experience in distributed data processing technologies: Redshift, Airflow, Presto and Looker.
  • Learn techniques for high volume distributed data processing and storages.
  • Ensure the integrity, availability, and confidentiality of data, database systems and supporting services.

The Essentials


  • You have a drive to learn, ask questions and motivation to find the answers.
  • You are familiar with one or more of these technologies: Python, PostgreSQL, Go
  • You are comfortable with DevOps cloud tools (Amazon, EC2, or Google Cloud) and have some working knowledge of monitoring tools
  • You have side projects or viewable public code on Github, Bitbucket, etc.
  • You are currently pursuing a BS or MS in Computer Science, Engineering, or related technical discipline, with an expected graduation date of 2020 or 2021

Bonus Skills


  • You love games and have checked out our current title
  • You are well-versed in object-oriented programming (OOP)
  • You have some experience with Hadoop or other data engineering or database software
  • You have side projects or viewable public code on Github, Bitbucket, etc.

The Perks



  • Exclusive WarnerMedia events and advance screenings
  • Paid time off every year to volunteer for eligible employees
  • Access to well-being tools, resources, and freebies
  • Access to in-house learning and development resources
  • Part of the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands

Warner Media, LLC and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

LaunchBay (based in North Billerica, MA) is a small company focused on product development and commercialization. Our team focuses on transforming early stage concepts into practical solutions to some of the world’s most challenging problems. We are looking for graduate student interns to assist with optimization of pilot scale production projects using artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML).

Your Impact:

  • Work closely with other chemical and mechanical engineers to develop and apply machine learning models to pilot projects
  • Perform data analysis to understand model performance and derive insights from data sets
  • Prepare reports and present the findings to peers unfamiliar with machine learning at project/program review meetings

Preferred qualifications:

  • A graduate-level student in data/computer science, electrical engineering, or other related disciplines
  • Strong grasp of machine learning concepts proven through academic or research projects
  • Competence in computer programming and automatic data processing
  • Critical thinking and excellent communication skills
  • Passion for applied research and product development

What you will get in return:

You will have a unique opportunity to create innovations and technical breakthroughs by applying machine learning methods to all stages of product development from concept to launch. You will also have ample opportunities to learn about quality control, systems thinking as well as small business development. Successful completion of this internship could lead to a full time position at LaunchBay.

We are looking for students that can work full time for 3-6 months but will accommodate part time and flexible working schedule as well.

Remote and in-person arrangements will be considered.

We offer competitive compensation and benefits.
No relocation/Local candidates preferred.
US citizenship or Permanent Residency required.

Ascend Learning is seeking a motivated, energetic Data Engineering Intern with background in data engineering and good communication skills in our Leawood, KS office.

Are you interested in joining a team delivering online education backed by data and analytics systems? Our team works with leading edge data technologies such as Snowflake, Elastic Search, Azure, Microsoft Bot framework, Confluent-Kafka, Kafka Connect, Kafka Streams, SQL Server, Google Material Design, Angular JavaScript, and Java. Join our team of data engineers, data architects, and data scientists to positively change the lives of our learners. Together we are developing software products that help people enter, sustain, and succeed in their careers.

In addition to experience with data technologies, successful candidates are versed in related systems including web and application servers, distributed logging, (remove enterprise message busses) search indexing systems, and enterprise security systems.

This is a Data Engineering Intern position in a team of data scientists, data engineers and data architects. In addition to experience with data technologies, successful candidates are versed in related systems including web and application servers, distributed logging, enterprise message busses, search indexing systems, and enterprise security systems.


Responsibilities:

  • Build data infrastructure software to support data and analytics, including quality, governance, lifecycle management, and compliance.
  • Work with a team of data scientists, data engineers and data architects, reporting to the Manager of Data and Analytics.
  • Work with the engineers, quality engineering, DBAs, information security, network, operations, product and project management teams to design and implement new business initiatives as related to data and analytics.
  • Help to create processes frameworks, design and implementation of data migration and data processing on Kafka, Pentaho, Snowflake and related platforms.
  • Evaluate current data environments, conduct research, recommend, and implement innovative designs that can enhance the reliability, security, productivity, and efficiency of the data infrastructure.
  • Assists other IT functional teams to troubleshoot critical business systems.
  • Help to ensure that data for top tier applications maintain a state of high availability.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills with all levels of users.
  • Public speaking experience a plus: we encourage people to participate in conferences.

Education and Experience:

  • Pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Systems Engineering, or related field.

  • Good understanding of RESTful web services.
  • Good understanding of data modeling techniques and understanding of database normalization.
  • Proficient in SQL.
  • Experience with Extraction, Transformation and Load (ETL) tools is a plus.
  • Experience with Kafka ecosystem and data-warehousing solutions like Snowflake is a plus.
  • Experience with JavaScript/Angular and/or BI tools like PowerBI or Tableau is a plus.

#LI-GF1

Position Summary

Parker Lord is currently seeking talented and highly motivated individuals that will assist engineers in the development, design, manufacturing, and testing of products for Parker LORD electro-mechanical applications. Assignments will include a variety of mechanical/electrical related tasks. Typical tasks may include performance/data analysis, prototype construction, solid modeling, application engineering, part change notice processing, customer print reviews/reviewing and understanding customer needs and expectations.

Responsibilities

In addition, the candidate will assist engineers in preparing product specifications/drawings (conceptualizing and designing cost effective solutions), product performance testing, preparing technical reports, documentation, and project coordination in support of the design engineer/product leader. The candidate must have flexibility, creativity, and enthusiasm to solve challenging problems in a team environment. Join Our Team Opportunities may be as follows depending on department.
  • Engineering and Design: You will assist engineers in the development, design, manufacturing, and testing of products for LORD. Typical tasks may include performance/data analysis, prototype construction, application engineering, part change notice processing, customer print reviews/reviewing and understanding customer needs and expectations, preparing product specifications/drawings (conceptualizing and designing cost effective solutions), product performance testing, preparing technical reports, documentation, and project coordination in support of the design engineer/product leader.
  • Quality: You may assist with planning, coordinating, and completing broadly defined quality engineering tasks, assignments or small projects to ensure compliance with customer technical expectations. You may work with Black Belt on Global Process Improvement projects utilizing Six Sigma DMAIC process. You may also assist with completion of gap analysis for new requirements, aid in management of audit data and closure, provide data analysis or investigation in projects and provide backup and improvement measures in technical spec review.
  • Engineering Test Lab: You will assist engineers in the development and testing of products for LORD mechanical applications. You will work on testing methods and processes to gain a better understanding of machinery, fixtures, and measurement methods as well as assist with mechanical assembly and gain experience in troubleshooting techniques. Typical activities associated with this position may include CAD modeling, test machining commission/troubleshooting, engineering data analysis, validation of machine and test parameters, and customer/supplier interaction.
  • Manufacturing: Assignments may include a variety of mechanical related tasks including working with the manufacturing engineers on shop floor execution, cost saving initiatives, troubleshooting, quality improvements, manufacturing instructions, etc. Typical tasks could also include data entry, computer analysis, researching potential vendors for new components or materials, application engineering, part change notice processing, customer print reviews/reviewing and understanding customer needs and expectations. You may also triage incoming technical questions and provide for LORD customers, as well as assist with documentation review.

    Qualifications

  • Must be enrolled in Computer Science or Engineering Major
  • Must be entering their Junior or Senior Year in Fall 2021.

    Parker Hannifin

    Founded in 1917, Parker Hannifin Corporation is a $13.7 billion, global company. With annual sales of $13.7 billion in fiscal year 2020, Parker Hannifin is the world's leading diversified manufacturer of motion and control technologies and systems, providing precision-engineered solutions for a wide variety of mobile, industrial and aerospace markets. The company has operations in 49 countries around the world. Parker has increased its annual dividends paid to shareholders for 63 consecutive fiscal years, among the top five longest-running dividend-increase records in the S&P 500 index. Parker’s engineering expertise and broad range of core technologies uniquely positions the company to solve some of the world’s greatest engineering challenges. By partnering with customers, Parker improves their productivity and profitability and seeks new ways to solve humanity's biggest challenges.

    Equal Employment Opportunity

    Parker is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. Parker is committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job related reasons regardless of race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, gender identity, genetic information, veteran status, or any other status protected by law. U.S. Citizenship/Permanent Resident is required for most positions.     Drug Tests

    Drug-Free Workplace In accordance with Parker’s policies and applicable state laws, Parker provides for a drug-free workplace. Therefore, all applicants seeking employment with Parker will be subject to drug testing as a condition of employment.

Job Brief

Aurora Flight Sciences, a Boeing Subsidiary, is seeking qualified Interns to actively participate in real-world assignments, help solve challenging problems and contribute to the development of the next-generation of autonomous aircraft.

Aurora Flight Sciences, a Boeing Subsidiary, is seeking qualified Interns to actively participate in real-world assignments, help solve challenging problems and contribute to the development of the next-generation of autonomous aircraft.

We Are Seeking Individuals With:

  • Structures Engineering or related experience.
  • A strong academic record.
  • Experience contributing to a team in a fast-paced, competitive and self-directed environment.

The duration of an internship typically lasts 8 - 12 weeks in any one of our sites:

Manassas, VA Headquarters, Engineering and Product Development
Cambridge, MA Research and Development
Bridgeport, WV Manufacturing
Columbus, MS Manufacturing and Final Assembly


Aurora offers a competitive compensation, housing and transportation allowance if required. Our mentors and team members guide you through your work, help you integrate in our culture of collaboration and further develop and gain new skills. Finally, during your time with us, we are interested in your input on how we can continue to enhance your experience in an environment of learning and at the end of your internship, we ask you to present your work experience and lessons learned to the company.


Requirements:

  • Enrollment in bachelor’s program with a focus in Engineering or a related field
  • Experience contributing to a team in a fast-paced/comparative and/or self-directed environment
  • Background knowledge in one of the following areas:
    • Aerospace/General Aviation
    • Flight Physics
    • Aerostructures
    • Computer Science
    • Autonomy
    • Robotics
    • Mechanical Systems
    • Propulsion
    • Manufacturing
    • Systems Engineering

Preferred Requirements:

  • Enrollment in a Master’s or PhD program
  • Participation in extracurricular activities

Physical Requirements:

  • The ability to travel to Aurora locations.

Aurora’s Mission

Aurora is a leader in the development and manufacturing of advanced unmanned systems and aerospace vehicles. Our mission is to apply autonomy and robotics to the development, production, and operation of advanced aircraft. We aim to change the way we travel. During the last three decades, Aurora has designed, rapid prototyped, and flown an average of one new vehicle a year for government and commercial customers. Now as an independent subsidiary of Boeing, Aurora’s innovation is combined with Boeing’s size and strength, creating an unprecedented opportunity to disrupt the future of the aerospace industry.

Come change the future of the aerospace industry with Aurora Flight Sciences.

Aurora Company Overview

Aurora Flight Sciences, a Boeing Company, is a leader in the development and manufacturing of advanced unmanned systems and aerospace vehicles. Our mission is to apply autonomy and robotics to the development, production, and operation of advanced aircraft. During the last three decades, Aurora has designed, rapid-prototyped, and flown an average of one new vehicle a year for both government and commercial customers. Now, as an independent subsidiary of Boeing, Aurora’s innovation is combined with Boeing’s size and strength, creating an unprecedented opportunity to shape the future of aerospace systems.

Equal Opportunity Employer

Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military/veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Sirius Technical Services is currently seeking candidates for a Material Science Engineering Intern role in Birmingham, AL. This is a long term contract role with the potential to go direct. It can be either part time or full time depending on student schedule. Info below:

RESPONSIBILITIES

1. Able to support the development of biomaterials for applications such as medical devices from the feasibility stage to the product launch.

2. Knowledge of polymer processing and scientific principles pertaining to and capable in the operation of standard laboratory, analytical, and/or processing and manufacturing equipment; examples include:

3. Perform Mechanical Testing: Low velocity impact, flexure, 4 point bending, tensile testing, compression testing, hardness testing, Scratch testing, and Tribometric testing.

4. Perform Thermal Analysis: Differential Scanning Calorimeter, Thermal Gravimetric Analyzer, Dynamic Mechanical Analyzer, Thermal Mechanical Analyzer, Gas Chromatography and Rheometers.

5. Perform Characterization: UV-Vis spectrometer, particle size analyzer, viscometer, Optical Microscopy, Scanning Electron Microscopy, and Interferometry.

6. Processing: Injection molding, extrusion, compounding, compression molding, fiber processing, spray coating, and plasma polymer coating.

7. Ability to understand and perform biological testing on polymeric biomaterials such as in vitro degradation and simulated bone formation. Experience with sterilization of medical device is a plus.

8. Generate, tabulate and draft data results. Present obtained results both internally and externally.

9. Maintain a thorough and accurate documentation including experimental methods, parameters, observations, data and results.

10. Follow SOPs and procedures.

About Pierce, an Oshkosh company

At Pierce Manufacturing, we build trucks that protect people and communities around the world. To our team, there is no room for anything less than providing the absolute best. Since 1913, building truck bodies on Model T Ford chassis in an old converted church has evolved to creating highly customized, carefully designed and engineering pumpers, aerials, tankers and rescue units that have no equal. Today, you'll find more than 27,000 Pierce trucks on the road that are making a difference in people's lives, every day. To us, every step in the process of building our trucks is personal. JOB SUMMARY:
The NC Programming Intern will assist in creating NC programs for cutting and punching materials in the fabrication department. The main objective of this role is to create NC programs in a timely manner to keep the fabrication department on schedule and keep CNC machines operating to cut and punch parts for various facilities. The NC Programming Intern will work closely with the production supervisors, team leaders, design engineers, quality control, and materials management to ensure that product, process and procedural changes are implemented smoothly.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

These duties are not meant to be all-inclusive and other duties may be assigned.

  • Clean up extraneous data from CAD drawings and save in format for input to nesting software to maintain a more efficient part library function.

  • Apply correct tooling for punched parts, placing tabs to hold part in sheet. Apply correct cutting paths to laser and waterjet parts placing tabs to hold part in sheet.

  • Perform nesting of parts, ensuring efficiency of part placement in material sheets; create NC programs for parts too large for nesting or requiring special tooling such as louvers.

  • Compare order revision to part library revision and update as needed to match manufacturing order; verify part is correctly routed to fabrication machines.

  • Ensure that NC programs are delivered to fabrication department before scheduled start date to ensure fabrication stays on schedule and deliver parts in time for next operation.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Student working towards an Associate’s degree for entire duration of internship.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

  • GPA of 3.0 or greater

position: EDG Intern - Bachelor Computer Science Majors
description:
Looking for Fall 2021 Interns!

Interns in our Engineering Development Group gain hands-on experience in a welcoming environment that fosters and rewards innovation, teamwork, learning, and fun. You will make an impact by contributing to a real-world project and working with bright, passionate colleagues to push the limits of engineering and science. Increase your knowledge of software engineering, testing, and debugging while also developing valuable professional skills, such as written and oral communications, problem solving, and time management.


After training on MathWorks processes and tools, you will collaborate with a development team to implement updates for a future release of one of our 100+ products, or help develop automated tests to verify that features in MATLAB or Simulink are functioning as designed.

This internship will prepare you for a career at MathWorks starting in our Engineering Development Group (EDG).


Qualifications Required

Working towards a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science

Qualifications Preferred

  • 3 month full-time commitment
  • Object Oriented Programming experience (One or more of C++, Java OR JavaScript)
  • Strong Communication skills
  • Strong academic record
  • MATLAB knowledge or experience is a plus

  • Candidates for this position must be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis for any employer without restriction.
  • Visa sponsorship will not be provided for this position.
  • Candidates must be pursuing a bachelor's level degree in a technical discipline.

Santa Ana, CA, USA Req #69

Wednesday, March 24, 2021

Iteris is the market leader in smart mobility infrastructure management providing superior services and patented products that help detect, measure, and manage mobility, minimize traffic congestion, enhance safety, and empower our clients with solutions to better manage their transportation networks.

We are paving the way to the future of transportation and we want you to join us on this important journey.

Solution Engineer Intern


Stonebranch builds dynamic IT automation solutions that transform business IT environments from simple IT task automation into sophisticated, real-time business service automation, helping organizations achieve the highest possible Return on Automation. No matter the degree of automation, Stonebranch software is simple, modern and secure. Using its universal automation platform, enterprises can seamlessly orchestrate workloads and data across technology ecosystems and silos. Headquartered in Alpharetta, Georgia with points of contact and support throughout the Americas, Europe, and Asia, Stonebranch serves some of the world's largest financial, manufacturing, healthcare, travel, transportation, energy, and technology institutions.


Your Part in this Growth Story:


Stonebranch is searching for a Solution Engineer Intern who’s interested in playing in the explosive IT automation market. As a Solution Engineer intern, you will contribute your knowledge and ideas in helping our Professional Services team on implementation projects of Stonebranch’s Universal Automation Center (UAC) family of products.


You will work under the guidance of a more senior engineer or team lead. Preference given to juniors, seniors, and recent graduates. This is a temporary role with potential to grow into a permanent position.


Your Impact on The Organization:


  • Participate in requirements sessions with the client to determine specific needs for product configuration.
  • Understand and participate in all the phases of Stonebranch’s UAC implementation including architectural analysis and design, deployment, conversion (from another existing software), development, optimization, and training.
  • Understand Stonebranch’s conversion methodology and support the client and other team members using it during a project implementation.
  • Understand the technical aspects of the conversion methodology and be ready to address issues and difficulties that may come up during the implementation process.
  • Take ownership tasks assigned to you and carry them out to completion in a timely manner.
  • Embrace Project Management and technical software implementation and configuration best practices.

What You Will Bring to the Team:


  • Full-time student pursuing undergraduate degree in one of the following fields or related studies: Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or Business Management.
  • Creative problem solving and critical thinking skills.
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills.
  • The desire and attitude to learn from Senior Engineers and work well in a collaborative environment.
  • Must be 18 years of age or older.
  • Knowledge of the following concepts and technologies:
  • One of the following programming languages: Java, Python, C and C++
  • High level knowledge of the Unix and Windows operating systems
  • Project Management concepts.
  • Basic understanding of SQL, HTML/Java Script and shell scripting.
  • Cloud architecture and concepts.
  • Must be legally permitted to work in the United States.

Why You’ll Love Stonebranch:


  • Competitive compensation
  • Workforce fitness program / gym reimbursement
  • Excellent health benefits
  • 401k to help you save for your future
  • Regular social events
  • Paid holidays and generous time off policy to rest and recharge
  • Convenient North-Atlanta location

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against applicants due to race, ethnicity, gender, veteran status, or on the basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

NVIDIA’s invention of the GPU in 1999 sparked the growth of the PC gaming market, redefined modern computer graphics, and revolutionized parallel computing. More recently, GPU deep learning ignited modern AI — the next era of computing — with the GPU acting as the brain of computers, robots, and self-driving cars that can perceive and understand the world. Today, we are increasingly known as “the AI computing company.” We're looking to grow our company, and build our teams with the smartest people in the world. Would you like to join us at the forefront of technological advancement?

Join our Jarvis conversational AI team and help build the real-time, cost-effective computing platform driving our success in this exciting and quickly growing field. Intelligent machines powered by AI computers that can learn, reason and interact with people are no longer science fiction. Today, a virtual assistant powered by AI can engage with human to answer questions and perform tasks. An AI-powered chatbot can learn conversation skills through trial and error. This is truly an extraordinary time. The era of AI has begun.

What you'll be doing:

As a Software Intern on our Jarvis team, you will be working on research, design and implementation of SW features in the Jarvis conversational AI and intelligent assistant. You will use machine learning, deep learning speech, NLP, and computer vision techniques combined with rules-based domain specification to build high performant conversational AI services with robust API interface for data center, cloud, and embedded platforms.

What we need to see:

  • Pursuing BS/MS degree in Computer Science/EE or related

  • Strong fundamentals in embedded systems, programming and SW design

  • You have strong knowledge of ML/DL techniques, algorithms and tools with exposure to CNN, RNN (LSTM), transformers (BERT & GPT-2/3), NLP, speech, and/or Computer Vision

  • Shown ability to develop robust and efficient APIs (REST, RPC, GRPC) for machine learning model inference and managing related workflows.

  • Excellent fluency with C/C++ and Python

  • Strongly believe that prototyping is the right way to prove the idea

Ways to stand out from the crowd:

  • NLP, speech or audio processing experience is highly desired

  • Experience with building machine learning model inference pipeline as a service

  • Experience with deploying machine learning models on data center, cloud, and embedded systems

  • Background with one of the following: dialog systems and conversational platforms, computer vision, signal processing

  • Familiarity with GPU computing (CUDA, OpenCL, OpenACC)

  • Background with Dockers and Kubernetes

  • Familiarity with ONNX and TensorRT

  • Worked with variety of vision, depth and audio sensors

NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world's most desirable employers. We have some of the most brilliant and talented people in the world working for us. If you're creative and autonomous, we want to hear from you!

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

position: Handshake Candidates Only - Michigan Year Round Intern
description:
Description

Job Description

Join the nation’s leading competitive energy provider, with one of the largest electricity generation portfolios and retail customer bases in the country. You will be part of a family of companies that strives for the highest standards of power generation, competitive energy sales, and energy delivery. Our team of outstanding professionals is focused on performance, thought leadership, innovation, and the power of ideas that come from a diverse and inclusive workforce.

Exelon will provide you the tools and resources you need to design, build and enhance a successful career. We are also dedicated to motivating the success of our employees through our outstanding base salary, incentives, and health and retirement benefits.

Join Exelon and share your passion at a forward-thinking Fortune 100 company. Establish yourself in a place where you can truly shine and create a brighter, more sustainable tomorrow. Energize your career at Exelon!

Qualifications

Qualifications:

Exelon is currently seeking highly motivated students for paid internships. Interns will work on projects designed to help them gain real-world, hands-on experience working independently under an assigned supervisor.

We are seeking students who meet the following criteria:

  • Currently enrolled in Bachelor's or Master's program
  • Minimum GPA: Cumulative 2.8/Major 3.0
  • A track record of outstanding academic performance
  • Ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment
  • Capacity and curiosity to research topics and find ways to perform the research in mass.
  • Ability to work independently in a remote environment

Majors include:

  • Business Administration / Management / Operations
  • Computer Science
  • Information Systems
  • Data Science
  • Engineering

Exelon is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and employees or applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to: age, color, disability, gender, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law. VEVRAA Federal Contractor. EEO is the Law Poster http://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/poster.cfm

Enjoy the fact of work in a professional environment which will help you to close the gap for the real world with real situations in a great working environment.

Support for your education

We help you to finish your career with economical incentives, we know the implications of being a student and all that comes with it.

Latest Technologies

Learn with us OpenSource technologies that will help you in all your school environment.

Become Family

The best coaches helping you to grow up in a personal and professional level.

How do we see you?

  • Imagination is more important than knowledge. For knowledge is limited to all we know and understand, while imagination embraces the entire world, and all there ever will be to know and understand.

What do we offer you?

Come and see...

You will be integrated into a great work environment, in a rich function, with a lot of opportunities to learn. Situated in several cities in Mexico, Venezuela and Peru, our offices provide a pleasant and friendly open space working environment for you to flourish in.

What's a typical day at Vauxoo?

Doing things great...

Belonging to the Professional Services (PS) department, our Functional team is divided in tree parts: Support, Quickstart and Projects. After a one-month training period, you will possibly go through the tree steps in your evolution, getting more and more varied experiences and skills.

Odoo consultants have different roles: you could be in charge of writing training material, giving training sessions to our customers or even helping colleagues on the first line support.

Our Odoo technical consultants improve day by day the tool and set of features using the best proffessional techniques.

But your main role remains to manage implementation projects and new features from A to Z:

  • First functional contacts with the customer
  • Analyze of its structures and flows
  • Implementation and training
  • Follow-up and support
  • As developer make new features

Your main contacts will be with Technical Officers or CEO's in SME's. Your role will then consist on giving them explanations about the use of Odoo apps and making the follow-up. Usually each consultant is in charge of approximately 10 projects.

You will directly be responsible of your own varied projects. This is an excellent opportunity for a "roll up the sleeves" consultant to take his/her career to the next level. You will work with the help of your colleagues but in total autonomy which is an opportunity for you to learn fast.

Requirements

Great communication skills


Willing to grow become a top dev at Vauxoo


Completed social service



Passion for coding


Fast learner


Computer science student

position: Interactive Voice Response (IVR) Technical Maintenance Intern
description:
Resp & Qualifications

This is a Year-Round Internship. We are looking for students who can commit to work up to 15-20 hours per week during the academic year in the Fall/Spring and 40 hours per week during the summer.

PURPOSE:

The IVR Technical Maintenance Intern role exists as a hire strategy to bring in incumbents enrolled in an accredited college or university who are pursuing a bachelor’s degree in a data science or related field to learn the business and technical side of IVR Technology Maintenance from the ground up. InterActive Voice Response Technology enables a CareFirst Member or a Provider of Medical, Dental or Vision services to receive answers to routine questions through the use of telephonic self service and enables intelligent phone call routing and call handing. This role will require interaction with IVR Support Technicians, Business Analysts and business partners within the organization. This position will use SQL and Java to perform maintenance, fulfill reporting requirements and research reports of trouble. This is a fast-paced, collaborative and iterative environment requiring quick learning, flexibility and problem solving.

PRINCIPLE ACCOUNTABILITIES:

Under the leadership and direction of a Manager of IVR Support, the principal duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to the following in a continuous learning environment. Resource will assist in the following:

  • Run SQL Queries (process documented/will train specifics) and copy the results to a excel sheet.
  • Run batch files (process documented/will train specifics)
  • Run reports from a web based portal (process documented/will train specifics) and distribute them
  • Run searches on logs to help with diagnostic research
  • Help technical staff with maintenance of tables and property files

QUALIFICATIONS:

Required

Undergraduate student enrolled in an accredited college or university at either the Junior/Senior level with a GPA of 3.25 or above. Student should be pursuing a degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics or closely related field. Graduate level students will also be considered.

Abilities/Skills

Students should possess the following skills:

  • Familiarity with windows servers
  • Familiarity with remote desktop
  • Familiarity with Microsoft Office and Teams
  • Familiarity or willingness to learn Splunk
  • Familiarity with SQL – we have pre-written queries that we will share for most things, but some may have to be written – like for table updates
  • Familiarity with Java
  • Strong research, analytical, written and oral communication skills
  • Ability to demonstrate problem solving skills and willingness to learn
  • Willingness to work with and learn new technologies

Department

Department: IVR Mainenance & Support Development

Equal Employment Opportunity

CareFirst BlueCross BlueShield is an Equal Opportunity (EEO) employer. It is the policy of the Company to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information.

Where To Apply

Please visit our website to apply: www.carefirst.com/careers

Closing Date

Please apply before: 6.29.21

Federal Disc/Physical Demand

Note: The incumbent is required to immediately disclose any debarment, exclusion, or other event that makes him/her ineligible to perform work directly or indirectly on Federal health care programs.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

The associate is primarily seated while performing the duties of the position. Occasional walking or standing is required. The hands are regularly used to write, type, key and handle or feel small controls and objects. The associate must frequently talk and hear. Weights up to 25 pounds are occasionally lifted.

Sponsorship in US

Must be eligible to work in the U.S. without Sponsorship

Description

Software Engineer Intern

Company: Hitachi America, Ltd.

Division: Social Innovation Business (SIB)

Location: Remote work with up to 10% travel (as needed)

Status: Intern, full time

Duration: 6 months from June 2021 – December 2022

Summary:

Hitachi Global Social Innovation Business (GSIB) is searching for a passionate Software Engineering intern who is comfortable working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment to assist with the development of new digital solutions that solve market-based problems.

GSIB is a division within Hitachi that is focused on delivering cutting edge, next-generation digital solutions to Hitachi customers, partners and ecosystems, with the goal of delivering economic, environmental and social value to society and improving the quality of life for people around the world. This position will play a role in developing and prototyping new solutions that solve real world problems.

Responsibilities:

  • Review and categorize existing pods of code for potential utilization in upcoming projects and demos
  • Create and present architecture and programing overviews to internal and external partner groups
  • Solve complex problems through prototyping of new tools and validating resolution
  • Support cloud-based initiatives of data storage, collection and mining
  • Engage with GSIB stakeholders to source information and requirements
  • Liaise with outside vendors and/or agencies as needed to support the work
  • Manage a range of development projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment

Qualifications:

  • Must be currently enrolled in an accredited bachelor’s degree program in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
  • Experience / knowledge of coding web-based software using Python, Java, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, HTML, XML, or CSS required
  • Demonstrated knowledge in cloud solutions like AWS, Azure or GCP preferred
  • Experience with IoT, Edge Devices and other sensor-based solutions preferred
  • Good quantitative analytical skills
  • Good oral and written communication skills
  • Ability to demonstrate initiative, critical thinking and problem-solving
  • Ability to work independently as well as with a team
  • Ability to prioritize tasks, meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
  • Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
  • Detail oriented and goal oriented with aptitude and enthusiasm for learning

Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE)-Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

position: Software Intern - Technical Program Management TPM
description:
at Rivian Automotive
United States, California, Palo Alto

Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.

As a company, we constantly challenge what’s possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations.

We operate development centers in Plymouth, Michigan; Southern California (Irvine, Carson & LA); Silicon Valley (San Jose and Palo Alto); Vancouver, British Columbia; and Surrey, England; as well as a manufacturing facility in Normal, Illinois.

The systems architecture & integration team is looking for a Technical Program Management TPM intern to assist with a variety of program coordination needs. The internship will consist of contributions to existing processes as well as the opportunity to drive the coordination efforts of a high level, cross-domain vehicle feature.

Responsibilities

  • Assist in the definition of cross vehicle features
  • Drive to completion the implementation and testing of vehicle features. Coordinating schedules across different teams and reporting status and highlighting concerns and blockers
  • Work with the software development team to track scope of releases and maintain accurate reporting and status throughout the CI/CD process

Qualifications

  • Pursuing a Bachelor's of Master's degree from an accredited college or university in Engineering, preferably in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Robotics, or related discipline
  • Good sense of system design & architecture
  • Organized & able to present information in a clear concise manner. Making use of graphical representations whenever appropriate.
  • Self-starter, always looking for ways to improve the current process
#LI-KC1

Equal Opportunity

Rivian is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: Rivian is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Rivian are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Rivian will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Rivian encourages applicants of all ages.

position: 3D NAND Mixed Signal Pre Silicon Verification Graduate Intern (-SK)
description:
Job Description


This position is associated with the sale of Intel's NAND memory and storage business to SK Hynix (You can read more about the transaction in the press release - https://newsroom.intel.com/wpcontent/uploads/sites/11/2020/10/nand-memory-news-q-a.pdf ).

This is an exciting time To be at Intel come join our team as an Intern and work on one of the most advanced 3DNAND and SSD technology portfolios in the world. As the global leader in the semiconductor industry Intel possesses many industry leading SSD technologies including the most capable Quadruple Level Cell QLC NAND Flash products You will be part of a world class team that will transition to lead the SSD business at SK hynix.

This position aligns to Phase 2 of the transaction which includes NAND technology and component development along with fab operations Employees aligned to Phase 2 will continue to be employed by Intel and will continue to develop NAND technology and components and manufacture NAND wafers at the fab. Phase 2 of the transaction is expected to close in March 2025 at which time employees aligned to this phase of the transaction will transition employment to SK hynix.

Responsibilities may be quite diverse of a technical nature US experience and education requirements will vary significantly depending on the unique needs of the job Job assignments are usually for the summer or for short periods during breaks from school. This is a 5 months internship with the possibility to be extended.


Qualifications


You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your school work/classes/research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences.

Minimum Requirements:

  • The candidate must be pursuing a MS or PhD degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or related field.


Minimum 5+ months of experience or equivalent coursework in the following areas:

  • Verilog design and verification

  • Logic design and Mixed signal simulation verification

  • CMOS circuit design and verification

  • Semiconductor Device Physics

  • Scripting skills in Perl/Python


Preferred Requirements:
Minimum 5+ months of experience or equivalent coursework in the following areas:

  • NAND Flash or NOR Flash or Non-Volatile Memory

  • UVM verification methodology

  • AMS verification methodology and techniques

  • Understanding of programming language such as C, C++, Java

  • Unix environment

Inside this Business Group


Non-Volatile Solutions Memory Group: The Non-Volatile Memory Solutions Group is a worldwide organization that delivers NAND flash memory products for use in Solid State Drives (SSDs), portable memory storage devices, digital camera memory cards, and other devices. The group is responsible for NVM technology design and development, complete Solid State Drive (SSD) system hardware and firmware development, as well as wafer and SSD manufacturing.


Other Locations

US, Oregon, Hillsboro;Virtual US and Canada


Posting Statement

Qorvo is All Around You! We manufacture innovative RF solutions at the center of connectivity to enable high-performance applications for advanced wireless devices, wired and wireless networks and defense radar and communications for 5G networks, cloud computing, the Internet of Things, and other emerging applications. position: Jr. React Native Application Development Intern
description:
Do you have a passion for using technology to bring about social change? Are you interested in working in engineering at a nonprofit? If so, join the Benetech team as a summer intern!

Benetech is a nonprofit that empowers communities with software for social good. Our work transforms how people with disabilities read, learn, and gain meaningful employment and makes it safer for human rights defenders to pursue truth and justice.

As Jr. React Native Application Development Intern, you will design, implement, and deliver high-quality software projects in React Native. You will also get to participate in detailed design, coding, code walk throughs, peer code reviews and unit testing, project demonstrations and maintenance of software codebases.

This is a full-time, summer internship that can be conducted remotely anywhere in the United States. Benetech is based in Palo Alto, CA. Benetech is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in its staff and encourages all qualified people to apply, including minorities, veterans, and individuals with disabilities. We firmly believe in Doing More Together – it’s even one of our Truths! You can read more about our underlying values here: Benetech Truths.

Other Responsibilities:

  • Ensure that project tasks are completed according to timelines.
  • Document and demonstrate solutions by developing documentation and delivering technical presentations.
  • Ability to effectively particulate in a well-defined and agile software process methodology.
  • Ability to accurately trouble shoot issues as they arise in both new and existing code.
  • Work effectively with stakeholders to understand use cases, engineers to collaborate on software development and QA teams to ensure quality software.

Required Skills / Qualifications:

Research shows that women and people from underrepresented groups often only apply to jobs if they meet all of the qualifications. However, no one ever meets 100% of the qualifications. Benetech encourages you to break that statistic and to apply. We look forward to your application.

  • Studying and/or active education in Computer Science
  • Minimum 1-4 years in software development projects across a variety of development projects
  • Basic proficiency in React Native.
  • Proficiency in JAVA, JavaScript, Servlets, EJB, J2EE and other JAVA technologies, some knowledge of AWS technologies a big plus.
  • Proficiency in User Interface design and implementation.
  • Proficiency in implementing Accessible User Interfaces a big plus.
  • Basic understanding of relational database concepts, database schema and the formulation of SQL queries and updates.
  • Ability to self-educate on new technologies that projects may require.
  • Ability to formulate unit test cases to achieve a high degree of code coverage.
  • Knowledge of current technological trends in the software development industry.

Title:

Decision Support Software Engineering Intern

A year-round software engineering intern position is available at NASA Ames Research Center to contribute to the development of System Health Enabled Realtime Planning Advisor (SHERPA).

SHERPA is decision support system based on the principles of decision making under uncertainty. It is being used in traverse planning for the Volatiles Investigating Polar Exploration Rover (VIPER), planned for launch in late 2023.

Candidates must be available to contribute at least 15-20 hours per week. Candidates local to the San Francisco Bay Area are preferred, however remote participation will be considered in certain circumstances.

Undergraduate or early MS

***Must be U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident***

Responsibilities:

  • Assist with SHERPA software development

  • Optimize software performance

  • Maintain code base and documentation

  • Ensure compliance with flight software standards

  • [Optional] Lead or contribute to the development of SHERPA’s web-based graphical user interface

  • [Optional] Perform project management duties: track schedule, deliverables, and requirements; coordinate execution of tasks

Required Education, Experience, & Skills:

  • Working towards Bachelor’s Degree in computer science or engineering field

  • Excellent general programming skills and fluency in at least one high-level programming language (e.g., Julia, Python, Java)

  • Extensive experience using debuggers, profilers, documentation generators, version control systems, and other common software engineering tools

  • Strong organizational and communication skills

  • Aptitude for consistently documenting code and work

Desired Education, Experience & Skills:

  • Working towards Master ‘s Degree in computer science or engineering field

  • Fluency in Julia programming language (development will be done mostly in Julia)

  • Understanding of fundamentals of decision making under uncertainty (e.g., at the level of Stanford AA228/CS238 course)

  • Developing web-based graphical user interfaces (HTML, JavaScript)

  • Leaflet JavaScript library or similar map-handling software

  • Experience with with developing code from software requirements documents

position: Software Intern- Factory and Automation Controls (Fall 2021)
description:
at Rivian Automotive
United States, Illinois, Normal

Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.

As a company, we constantly challenge what’s possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations.

We operate development centers in Plymouth, Michigan; Southern California (Irvine, Carson & LA); Silicon Valley (San Jose and Palo Alto); Vancouver, British Columbia; and Surrey, England; as well as a manufacturing facility in Normal, Illinois.

Los Angeles based Internet Brands is looking for a Quality Assurance Intern to be part of the QA team. This position has great potential for learning and advancement.

Quality Assurance Interns will be responsible for executing black box testing on a number of web-based projects under the guidance of senior QA team members. They will be trained in the company’s Quality Assurance process and be given opportunities to contribute to the creation of test cases and scripts.

The ideal candidate will have a background in computer science, meticulous attention to detail, strong analytical skills, and strong written and verbal communication skills. A degree in Computer Science or web development experience is strongly encouraged, but is not required. Prior quality assurance experience or software development experience is a plus.

Responsibilities:
  • Executing black box tests on all web-based and desktop application-based products.
  • Executing and help develop automated test cases.
  • Identifying issues and generating issue reports.
  • Reproducing customer-reported issues.
  • Assisting developers with issue analysis.
  • Developing automated test scripts.
  • Actively participating in test case design and script maintenance.
  • Verification of patches and bug fixes.
  • Interfacing closely with programmers and other QA engineers.

Qualifications:
  • An understanding of web-delivered applications.
  • Familiarity with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, or other web development languages.
  • Familiarity with multiple web browsers (Internet Explorer, Firefox, Safari, Chrome, etc.)
  • Experience with Microsoft Office (Word & Excel).
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills within a team environment.
  • A Bachelors of Science degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering, or enrollment in one of these majors, is a plus but not required.
  • Experience working in a web development company is a plus.
  • Software development experience is a plus.
  • Software quality assurance experience is a plus.

About Internet Brands:

Headquartered in El Segundo, Calif., Internet Brands® is a fully integrated online media and software services organization focused on four high-value vertical categories: Health, Automotive, Legal, and Home/Travel. The company's award-winning consumer websites lead their categories and serve more than 250 million monthly visitors, while a full range of web presence offerings has established deep, long-term relationships with SMB and enterprise clients. Internet Brands' powerful, proprietary operating platform provides the flexibility and scalability to fuel the company's continued growth. Internet Brands is a portfolio company of KKR and Temasek. For more information, please visit www.internetbrands.com.

Internet Brands and its wholly-owned affiliates are an equal opportunity employer.

Software Engineers at Citadel create next generation software solutions that help produce systems that power our investment research, trading, risk management, and funding & settlement systems. Software Engineers continually improve the efficiency and effectiveness of our investment process and reduce operational risk. Software Engineers partner closely with business leaders to develop and deliver software solutions that drive meaningful business outcomes. We build a range of critical solutions from pre-trade research platforms to trading systems to post-trade clearing and settlement services. These solutions include high availability, high throughput systems scaling to millions of transactions per second.

As an intern, you’ll get to challenge the impossible in technology through an 11 week program that will allow you to collaborate and connect with senior team members and our CEO Ken Griffin. In addition, you’ll get the opportunity to network and socialize with peers at iconic venues.

Your Objectives:

· Create technological tools that bring trading strategies to life

· Develop high-performance, large data research platforms

· Work in small teams to build the future of finance

  • Exceptional programming and design skills
  • Strong analytical skills and familiarity with probability and statistics
  • Ability to communicate effectively in a collaborative, complex and highly technical team environment
  • Intellectual curiosity and passion for solving challenging problems using technology

Opportunities available in Chicago, New York, London

About Citadel

Citadel is a global investment firm built around world-class talent, sound risk management, and innovative leading-edge technology. For thirty years, Citadel’s hedge funds have delivered meaningful and measurable results to top-tier investors around the world, including sovereign wealth funds, public institutions, corporate pensions, endowments and foundations.

With an unparalleled ability to identify and execute on great ideas, Citadel’s team of investment professionals, operating from offices including Chicago, New York, San Francisco, London, Hong Kong and Shanghai, deploy capital across all major asset classes, in all major financial markets.

position: Aircraft Protection Systems Software Co-op/Intern Fall 2021- ELSYS
description:
GTRI’s Cooperative Education (“co-op”) program offers you extensive opportunities to participate in diverse scientific and technological endeavors, use state-of-the-art equipment and rapidly improve your technical and leadership skills. The program allows you to alternate three semesters of full-time work at GTRI with semesters of full-time school.

The Electronic Systems Laboratory (ELSYS) is currently seeking a Co-op Student in the Test Engineering Division (TEN) for fall 2021. TEN researches next generation Aircraft Protection systems used to shield US and coalition aircraft from adversary radar and missile systems. These complex systems provide advanced detection of adversary systems that enable aircraft to avoid or counter these systems and return home safely.

This broad range of research will provide a solid foundation for the student as a future software engineer. The student will work under the guidance of GTRI researchers performing research in one of the following areas -

  • Sensing and processing broad bands of the electromagnetic spectrum
  • Creating a complex electromagnetic environment used to test Aircraft Protection systems
  • Using Machine Learning for data analysis applications

The student researcher will perform one or more of the following activities -

  • Design, code, and debug of Windows Software (SW), Embedded Software (SW), or Linux (SW) for aircraft protection systems and aircraft protection systems test applications
  • Conduct testing of Windows, Embedded, or Linux Systems software

Required Minimum Qualifications

Co-op
  • Pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering
  • Must have a 3.0 or higher GPA
  • Must be registered for co-op credit with your university (Co-op only)

Intern

  • Pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering
  • 3.0 or higher cumulative GPA
  • Must commit to a single semester full-time internship. The work term is August 2021- December 2021
